intro: Piresiella strephioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf piresiella, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or greenish-white, with five petals and a hairy calyx. It thrives in coastal areas and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
